alert.note: Alert for Perry (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 03 at 12:01PM CST until February 03 at 12:45PM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Perry County in southeastern Mississippi... * Until 1245 PM CST. * At 1200 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located near Rock Hill, or 12 miles south of Hattiesburg, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Richton, Beaumont and New Augusta. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Damaging winds and continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southeastern Mississippi.
